page.title: 10HEALTH. SEWAGE AT WILLEY.
page.content: Septic tank drainage is common to all properties in the area. With gravel subsoil, the disposal of fluids presents no problem.When the solids build up in the tanks these are emptied by local contractors, the waste being pumped into tankers and taken away for disposal directly onto the land of local farms. The cost of this service is borne by the householder. Care has to be taken not to use strong disinfectants which could interfere with the bacteriological processes in the tank, essential to the digestion of solids. New sewage installations are preformed fibreglass cylinders and not brick built chambers as hitherto.
